title: BUILD DAY X TOUR: ATLANTA HACKATHON
description: Start your experience of Atlanta Tech Week with Build Day X: Atlanta, our 24 hour Innovation Bootcamp! We invite you to join us at our brunch, where our pitch competition will set the stage for a week of learning and networking. Join industry leaders and aspiring innovators for a week packed with workshops, talks, and opportunities to network. Be part of the movement that drives technological innovation and community in Atlanta!
event_details: What is BDX?Think accelerator on steroidsâyouâll build your own startup team, collaborate on ideas, and sprint on real work (whether itâs your own idea or a new business). Participants will have 24 hours to build a working prototype. By the end, that shiny idea you had will turn into a beautiful prototype that you will pitch. The first place winning team will receive $10,000, the second place team will receive $5,000 and the third place team will get $2,500!!We will also provide meals, snacks and beverages to keep you hydrated and fed for the entire event!

title: Tech Is Personal: Meetups to Marriage
description: Tech Is Personal: Meetups to Marriage w/Local App Developers
event_details: In today's world, technology isn't just a tool; it's an integral part of our lives. From meeting new friends to finding lifelong partners, tech applications have revolutionized the way we connect and build relationships. As we transition into an era where technology not only gathers endless data on our activities but also supports our mental, physical, spiritual, financial, and relationship well-being, it's crucial to understand its impact.Join us for an engaging event that explores the intersection of technology and personal life in a unique speed dating-style format. Our panelists, comprised of app creators and tech experts, will be interviewed in quick, dynamic sessions, offering insights into the minds behind the apps we rely on. Discover who these creators are developing for, and delve into the considerations they take regarding the mental side effects of app usage.After the panel, attendees will have the opportunity to participate in a speed meeting session, fostering new connections in a fun and interactive environment. Whether you're interested in the latest tech trends, looking to meet like-minded individuals, or curious about the future of tech in our personal lives, this event is for you.Come ready to connect, learn, and explore how technology shapes our personal interactions from meetups to marriage.

title: C-Suite Connect: Jay Deuskar, PrizePicks
description: Join Dualboot Partners and ATV for a conversation with the co-founder of PrizePicks.
event_details: Join us for an exclusive fireside chat withÂ Jay Deuskar, Co-Founder and CTO of PrizePicks.Atlanta Tech Village graduate, PrizePicks is a pioneering platform in the daily fantasy sports (DFS) industry. PrizePicks has revolutionized the way fans engage with their favorite sports, offering a dynamic and user-friendly experience that has set new standards in the industry.Learn more about the team behind the innovation and how Jay and his co-founder, Adam Wexler, built PrizePicks from the ground up. Jay will discuss the ins and outs of the DFS industry and how PrizePicks navigates this competitive space.We'll delve into the technological advancements shaping the industry and hear Jay's firsthand thoughts on emerging technologies, the role of data analytics, and how PrizePicks leverages tech to enhance user experience.Donât miss this chance to connect with one of the leading minds in the DFS industry. Whether you're an entrepreneur, a tech enthusiast, or simply interested in the future of fantasy sports, this event promises valuable insights and networking opportunities.AboutÂ Jay DeuskarJay DeuskarÂ is the Co-founder and CTO of PrizePicks.Â Jay is an Atlanta native who's been involved in the startup scene for over a decade and has 6+ years in the fantasy gaming space.Previously, Jay operated startups in the consumer finance space, most notably Capp.io, which ended in an exit. Jay is an alumnus of Georgia Tech.About the seriesC-Suite Connect is a series at Atlanta Tech Village, powered by Dualboot Partners, designed to bridge the gap between ambitious entrepreneurs and seasoned C-Suite executives in the startup ecosystem. This event offers a unique opportunity to gain insights from the industry leaders who are shaping the future of business and technology.This series is powered and moderated by Dualboot Partners.

title: Startup Summer School: The What, Why, and How of Building a Scalable Startup
description: Join us for the first session of our Startup Summer School series with Kathryn O'Day, Partner at Atlanta Venture
event_details: Calling all aspiring entrepreneurs!Â Kickstart your summer with the first workshop of Atlanta Tech Village's Startup Summer School series.About the Workshop:_What are the secrets to building a big company?Â __How do you pick the right idea, get early customers, raise the money you need?Â _Can you do it on your own, with a family, or without a tech background?Â (Hint: YES!)_Come learn the why, what, and how of building big!Â _In this session, we will cover:Impact and effort of billion dollar companiesHow to pick a big marketHow to get your first customersBuilding techRaising capital**About Kathryn O'Day: **_Kathryn is a partner at Atlanta Ventures who is passionate about supporting women founders. She's scaled multiple Atlanta startups to public company exits and seen first hand what goes into building billion dollar companies.Â _

title: Startup Summer School: The Customer Discovery Playbook
description: Our second workshop in the 10-week Startup Summer School series
event_details: This workshop is for founders that are looking to build a rock solid foundation for their business. The majority of startups fail because they don't have the right customer, the right product, or both. If you're looking to build the right product for the right customer, customer discovery is your best friend.Whether you're just starting out, or you're having trouble selling your current product, customer discovery is the answer.**About the Facilitator: **Kyle Painting is the Founder of My Influency and the Director of Business Development for EZ Innovation. Kyle is a true champion of customer discovery, customer centricity, and resilience.

title: Panel: The Future of Atlanta Tech Village
description: Join the leaders of South Downtown and Atlanta Tech Village for a conversation on the expansion of Atlanta Tech Village.
event_details: At the start of 2024, David Cummings and David Lightburn, founders of Atlanta Tech Village, along with Jon Birdsong acquired 7% of Downtown Atlanta: 53 Buildings and 6 Acres of parking lots.Since news broke, Atlanta Tech Village has opened a pop-up location (ATV - Mason's) and has started renovations on the new location on Hotel Row (Atlanta Tech Village - Sylvan) which will host office space for both tech and creative entrepreneurs.Join us for a panel discussion to learn about the vision and direction for Atlanta Tech Village in South Downtown.

title: Women Founder & Funder Wellness Event *invite only*
description: Women founder event
event_details: âThe Better Spot and Techstars Atlanta Powered by Cox Enterprises are hosting anÂ immersive wellness event for ambitious women leaders who want to build resilience, prevent burnout and establish boundaries in their work and life.âThis event will offerÂ intimate sessions ofÂ Restorative Yoga and Clarity Breathwork led by certified practitioners onÂ The Better Spot.Â Through mindful movement and focused breathwork, you can release stress, enhance self-awareness, and cultivate emotional balance, which are essential for navigating the challenges of startup life.âPreparationâArrive in ready-to-move clothing (Restrictive clothing means half-hearted participation.)âYoga mat (It may be a hassle to bring, but the alternative is the floor. There will be enough time after the event to drop your mat at your vehicle prior to the Ponce City Market Atlanta Tech Week events.)âWater bottle (Despite refreshments and a water station, a personal water bottle is always a plus.)âAfterwards, stick around because Atlanta Tech Week is taking over Ponce CIty Market, starting at 6pm! title: Speed Netwerk

event_details: âCome join us for an exciting evening of networking atÂ Rock Steady - Atlanta! title: Black Innovation Alliance ATL mixer

event_details: Join us for a dynamic and inspiring mixer at the Russell Innovation Center for Entrepreneurs (RICE) in Atlanta, hosted by the Black Innovation Alliance (BIA). This event is a unique opportunity for members dedicated to advancing Black innovation and entrepreneurship.For more information about the work of Black Innovation Alliance and RICE, visit Black Innovation Alliance and Russell Innovation Center for Entrepreneurs.

title: Atlanta Tech Week Main Stage
description: Delve into the dynamic world of technology alongside industry luminaries and trailblazers who are shaping the future of Atlanta's tech landscape.
event_details: Join us at the main stage of Atlanta Tech Week for an electrifying convergence of innovation and inspiration! Delve into the dynamic world of technology alongside industry luminaries and trailblazers who are shaping the future of Atlanta's tech landscape. This unparalleled gathering offers an exclusive opportunity to glean insights from the brightest minds in the field, covering topics from AI to blockchain and beyond. Best of all, attendance is entirely free, making it the perfect forum to connect, collaborate, and cultivate relationships with fellow tech enthusiasts throughout the week of events. Don't miss out on this transformative experience where ideas flourish, connections thrive, and possibilities abound. See you at the heart of Atlanta's tech revolution!

event_details: Come listen to some of the TOP ATL VOICES about how we are building in ATL. From infrastructure, Startup, Education and ecosystem leaders

title: Lead Like a Mother: Uniting Women in Leadership
description: The "Lead Like a Mother" event, part of #ATLTechWeek, aims to unite and empower entrepreneurial women balancing leadership and caregiving through talks, activities, and light refreshments, fostering shared experiences and support.
event_details: Are you ready to be inspired, supported, and motivated? âLead Like a Motherâ is your opportunity to meet and bond with like-minded women tackling the unique experiences of leading businesses while managing family life. Taking place duringÂ Atlanta Tech Week, this event is a heartfelt invitation to entrepreneurial women in all walks of lifeâfrom mothers to those in other caregiving roles.âOur gathering is more than just a meeting; itâs a sanctuary where experiences are shared, challenges are voiced, and victories are celebrated. Dive into discussions on what it takes to flourish both at home and in the boardroom, and leave equipped with actionable insights and a supportive community backing your every step. Join us on Thursday, June 13, 2024, from 9:45 AM to 12 PM, and step into a space where leadership and motherhood converge.

title: America Has A Problem
description: Join us to discuss how we can improve digital services in America - let's fix this problem together!
event_details: Calling all civic tech technologists and the curious ones! Technology is embedded in everything we do - across education, transportation, immigration, and health and human services - and it's essential to integrate the Black experience into processes we build, as well as policies that are written to govern them. In this session, we dive into our work in fixing government services, the stories we hear and the opportunities we have to make equitable and accessible technology now.

title: Food Truck Park
venue: Atlanta Tech Week Food Truck Park
description: Indulge your senses at the vibrant Food Truck Park during Atlanta Tech Week, where culinary delights and cultural fusion take center stage!
event_details: Indulge your senses at the vibrant Food Truck Park during Atlanta Tech Week, where culinary delights and cultural fusion take center stage! Embark on a tantalizing journey through Atlanta's diverse food scene, curated to satisfy every craving and ignite your taste buds. From savory street tacos to decadent desserts, our lineup of top-notch food trucks promises an unforgettable gastronomic adventure. Plus, with free admission, this gastronomic extravaganza is the ultimate gathering place to mingle, network, and forge meaningful connections amidst the week's festivities. Whether you're a tech aficionado or simply a foodie at heart, join us at the Food Truck Park to celebrate flavor, community, and innovation. Come hungry, leave inspired!

title: BPM: Growth Design with Fonz Morris (Netflix)
venue: Hotel Indigo Atlanta Downtown, an IHG Hotel
description: Calling all product managers! Want to unlock the secrets of growth used by industry leader Netflix? Join the Black Product Managers Network (BPM) for a special session on Growth Design featuring Fonz Morris, Lead Product Designer- Global Conversion at Netflix.
event_details: âCalling all product managers! Want to unlock the secrets of growth used by industry leader Netflix? Join the Black Product Managers Network (BPM) for a special session on Growth Design featuring Fonz Morris, Lead Product Designer- Global Conversion at Netflix. This event is your chance to learn from the best, whether you're a mid-career PM with 3+ years of experience looking to elevate your growth skills, or an aspiring PM eager to understand how top companies achieve explosive user bases.âIn this session, Fonz will demystify Growth Design, the science behind driving continuous improvement. You'll learn how Netflix leverages these principles to optimize their platform and gain a practical framework you can use to directly impact your own key metrics. Fonz will also share real-world Netflix case studies, showcasing best practices you can implement in your product development process. Don't miss this unique opportunity to gain the knowledge and tools to maximize your impact as a product manager. Space is limited, so RSVP today!

title: BPM: From Product Manager to Founder
venue: Hotel Indigo Atlanta Downtown, an IHG Hotel
description: Are you a product manager with a fire in your belly? Join the Black Product Managers Network (BPM) and Atlanta Tech Week for a fireside chat exploring the exciting leap from product leader to founder.
event_details: This event is for you if:âYou're a mid-career product manager with entrepreneurial aspirations.âYou're a new founder looking to refine your approach.âYou're passionate about building something game-changing.âNetwork with fellow PMs, founders, investors, and mentors and leave empowered with the knowledge and connections to take your entrepreneurial dreams to the next level.

title: Crafting Cinematic Worlds with AI
description: Script to Screen: Crafting Cinematic Worlds with AI
event_details: Join us to bring your ideas to life and see how your scripts can come alive with the help of generative AI.This session is designed for technologists, filmmakers, and storytellers looking to bridge the gap between narrative creation and visual execution.In this workshop, you'll learn how to use AI as a collaborator from ideation to scriptwriting, storyboarding, 3D world creation, and 2D video editing. We'll explore the latest tools that enable you to generate detailed environments and realistic characters.

title: CTO Happy Hour
description: Meet-up with fellow industry leading technologists to chat product, trends, culture and more. Current and aspiring CTOs are welcome.
event_details: Broaden your network and learn best practices from fellow engineering leaders in a casual setting. This CTO happy hour is the perfect opportunity to learn about trending topics and best strategies being adopted by the industry's best.

title: Atlanta Blockchain Center 2nd Anniversary Bash

event_details: We're thrilled to celebrate 2 incredible years of empowering Web3 founders and fostering a thriving blockchain community in ATL. Join us as we raise a glass (or your beverage of choice) to supporting over 20 Web3 founders in their journeys, and hosting a whopping 100+ FREE weekly educational events to bring the world of onchain technology to the ATL masses. It's been an amazing adventure, and we can't wait to celebrate with you!

event_details: Join us for an exclusive Leadership Circle event featuring a panel of VCs and dynamic startup founders who have successfully navigated the challenges and triumphs of building a business from the ground up. This is a unique opportunity to network with fellow leaders and engage in a thought-provoking discussion about the future of entrepreneurship. Don't miss this chance to be inspired and empowered by those who have dared to dream big!

title: Access: Tech + Digital Literacy + Marginalization
description: In an increasingly digital world, the divide between access to technology and digital literacy skills and those without is widening. Cyberpoverty is an increasing challenge, particularly in rural communities. Come joing this engaging #ATLTechWeek panel, led by Cassia Baker of Georgia Tech MEP, Clarence Anthony of the Partnership for Inclusive Innovation & Google's Stephen Ichatha.
event_details: In an increasingly digital world, the divide between access to technology and digital literacy skills and those without is widening. Cyberpoverty is an increasing challenge, particularly in rural communities. Come joing this engaging #ATLTechWeek panel, led by Cassia Baker of Georgia Tech MEP, Clarence Anthony of the Partnership for Inclusive Innovation & Google's Stephen Ichatha, will explore the barriers marginalized communities face in accessing technology and developing essential digital skills.

title: Techturized Beauty Tech Summit
description: MYAVANA presents the inaugural Techturized Beauty Tech Summit at the Georgia Institute of Technology, celebrating the roots of the beauty tech empire on their 12 year company anniversary.
event_details: MYAVANA presents the inaugural Techturized Beauty Tech Summit at Georgia Tech, celebrating the birthplace of their beauty tech empire. As pioneers in personalized hair care, we're gathering our Hair & Beauty Network to showcase our innovations and transformation of the hair industry through science and technology. This event honors Black women-led beauty tech businesses, featuring insightful panels, dynamic entrepreneurship discussions, and exclusive networking with key industry leaders. Join us in Atlanta, GA, the hair care capital, as we stake our claim in the booming beauty industry.
